title: The specialized assistance of tax specialists Johannesburg (Richard Mathhews)
text: By Richard Mathhews Jul 4, 2015 There are many tax consultants who take on the role of financial experts in order to assist clients who face different tax issues. One could seek their help in order to prepare their tax returns or ask them to represent them legally. Many even need advice in the right way of filing taxes. Hence, there are different ways that tax specialists Johannesburg operate. As per the kind of service availed, their fees as well as licensing requirements vary greatly in this country.The most common role of personal tax companies and the tax specialists Johannesburg whom they employ is to help clients in preparing as well as filing their tax returns. This is a valuable service as many taxpayers are unable to pay or file their taxes properly and they attract penalty payment as a result. When tax returns are prepared incorrectly one may miss out on rebates that are applicable to them and end up paying more. The system of making estimates in advance exists in certain countries and here one can recover excess payments by the end of the financial year.The tax consultants also provide advice and assistance on general tax matters. For instance, if one is setting up a business they would want to know the taxes that would be applicable for them. The tax lawyers can also help them to rearrange payments in a way that these fall in a different taxable period which reduces the tax burden on people. There are separate categories of personal tax lawyers, those who help in preparation of income tax returns and those who provide consultancy and assistance on personal tax matters.The fees charged by these tax consultants or lawyers vary accordingly. Some people charge a flat fee, especially when it comes to preparation of the income tax statement. For others there is a varying fee structure which is based on the time that is spent on the project or in calculation of taxes payable or the consultancy offered. Again, some lawyers might base their fee as a percentage of the rebate earned by the clients.There are many personal tax companies that offer the services of their lawyers during audit. The consultant will act as a representative to the company or the tax payer when an audit is scheduled. That leads to the lawyer representing the client and answering all the questions that are put forward by the tax officials at the time of audit. Many tax consultants have different areas of specialization in the matter of taxation. Hence, when looking up the services of a lawyer, one needs to know the kind of service he or she provides and their area of specialty. That way it is easier to appoint a lawyer and a lawyer to understand the case of the client and to get down to work. One can find related legal assistance services through online directories. It is necessary to find a registered firm or a licensed individual to handle tax matters on one's behalf.
